text:
Old rating rerated 10.05.2017, tap @ Mikkeller Bar:
Small slightly fizzy-creamy mediumlasting head, slightly hazy. Aroma is mild sour-ish fruity, oak, fruit stones, minerals, sorrel, calvados, old rope, mild vinegar, apple peel, grass, hay. Taste is slightly dry sour-ish fruity, citrus peel, sorrel, mild vinegar, oak, fruit stones, minerals, bark, grass, calvados, hay, apple peel. Medium bitterness, slightly dry mineraly mouthfeel. Nice one.
Draft from Mikkeller Bar. Pours a slightly hazy orange, white head. Strong funk, citrus, green apples, oak, tannines. Medium sour. Medium body & carbonation.
On tap at Mikkeller Viktoriagade. Hazy amber pour with a thin off-white head. Notes of lambic funk, citrus, green apple, cognac, oak. Lightly mouth-puckering.

On tap at Koelschip, march 26th 2016. Hazy light amber body with white rim. Aroma of ripe dark fruit, vinegar, oak. Taste is sour with citrus fruit, wood and red apples. Funky finish, leaving a solid calvados aftertaste.
Amber color white head, good retention and nice lacing. Aroma has acidic notes, some fruitness. Flavor with vinegar hints, some white wine. Good presence on palate with fruity mouthfeel.
Possibly on draught at Ramen to Biiru. Cant find anything else that matches the general "lambic." Dry and full of lemon grapefruit notes.
From tap at Koelship. Hazy golden colour with an off-white head. Aroma and flavour of fruit, oak, apples, tartness ,mcitrus and dry.

Tap @ Koelschip, Copenhagen. Pours light hazy golden. Aroma is sharp acidic, green apples, lots of calvados, funky, muldy, grapey, light alcoholic. Taste is green apples, funky, tart, lemony, old muldy overripe apples.
Tap @ Mikkeller bar, Stefansgade. Still golden pour. Nose has lemon juice, apple skin and some funk. Taste has lemon zest, tart apple juice, leather and some sweet vanilla.
Tap @ mikkeller, Aarhus. Aroma of tart malt. Hazy amber with white head, not lasting. Taste is moderate sour, light sweet. Medium body, dry feel, avg. carb., sour fresh finish.
from tap. Hazy golden color with small off white head. Funky fruity aroma, barnyard notes, wood, sweet fruity notes. Sweet and light acidic taste. Light thin to oily body with soft carbonation.

Tap @ mikkeller & friends. Pours a smooth golden color. Aroma is sour än bretty with hints of lovely calva oak. Taste is sour bretty and oakey. Like a rough lambic that wants to shake up your taste buds. Dry finish

Aroma and taste is fruity and floral hoppy, prominent lemon, some wooden notes, pretty decent overall.

February 9, 2015. On tap at Mikkeller Bar Stockholm. 
Hazy golden with a small white head. Aroma is tart green apples, lemon, barnyard, oak and calvados. Taste is tart citrus and apples, light sweet fruity, dry woody. Finish is apple, citrus and oak. Light bodied.

(Draught at Mikkeller Bar Stockholm, 11 Feb 2014) Golden colour with frothy, white head. Fruity, sour nose with notes of unripe green grapes, green apples and barnyard. Tart, fruity taste with stable, grapefruit, green grapes and a dry, tart finish with barnyard notes. More than medium body, dry. Fresh and tasty lambic, with a gentle wood character. Nice one.
Overall: Peach, grape, vinegar, leather.Note: On-tap at Mikkeller Bar. Reviewed 2015-02-20.

How: Draught.
Where: Mikkeller Bar, Stockholm.
Appearance: Hazy golden colour with a small white head.
Aroma: Tart, citrus, floral, sour.
Body: Medium body, low carbonation.
Flavour: Sour, citrus, grapes, tart.

Keg at Mikkeller, Stockholm.  Lightly hazy golden, small head. Tart nose with lemon, butter and calvados. Tart and mildly citric with medium, body and clean, rounded mouthfeel. Not much barnyard, more juicy lemon and oak. Low bitterness.

Draught at Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen, 14.1.2015. Hazy orange, white head. A little raspberry, delicate yogurt aroma, sour, acidic, sweet undertones and then a little citrus taste. Dry, medium body, a little citrus finish.
Frisk och fruktig arom. Syrlig och druvig i smaken, lagom balans. Lämnar med en citrus eftersmak.

backlog rating: 
Lactic grassy aroma.
Cloudy orange, no head.
Medium body. Not to my taste at that point in time.
Tap at mikkeller bar, copenhagen. Hazy orange color, white head. Aroma is fruity, sour, some sweet notes like cognac. Sour fruits, apples, maybe hint of that calvados barrel.
hay, herbs, basement aromas, earthy, golden, hazy, minimal head, lightly bitter, medium sourness, light body, oily feel, soft carbonation, long finish,

Tap at Mikkeller, Victoriagade. Poured a slightly hazy medium amber with a frothy white head. The aroma is citrus acid yeast. The flavour is moderate sour with a big zesty acidic citrus palate and a bubbly mouthfeel with a long acidic sour finish. Medium to light bodied with lively carbonation.

(On tap at Mikkeller Bar Stockholm, Nov 16 2014) Pours a lightly hazy medium orange with no head at all. Aroma has apple somewhere between lightly sour and tart, hints of some sweet tropical fruits, a moderate amount of calvados barrel and some funky barnyard lambic character. On the palate, tart apple and wheat to start, bit of grass, Brett type sourness, wood. Dries out as the sip goes down, wood becomes more prominent, calvados character reaches its peak. Hay in the finish, lightly tart funk on the roof of the mouth, bit of remaining calvados barrel on the tongue, quite dry. Hint of alcohol. Light but slightly chewy body with soft, sparse carb. Kind of a funny lambic, I would expect even an unblended 2yo to be a bit more sour than this. Barrel comes through pretty well, unique, interesting to try but one is enough - fairly drinkable but not gulpable.
Tap @ Øl & Brød, Copenhagen 16/7-14. Fruity with tropical and light acidic notes, mango. Has a dry finish.
Tap @ Øl & Brød, Copenhagen. Aroma: Fruity, mango, tropical notes, fresh, light acidic. Taste: Dito. The finish is dry.
draught at Mikkeller Stockholm. Nice smooth and medium bodied brew, thirst quenching. Fruity with light barnyard tartness.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Orange hazy, Wheaty, light apple, tart, with pretty nice barnyeardy notes on the nose. Dry tart body, light maltyness, bit lacking in flavour actually.

Tap at Mikkeller & Friends, Copenhagen. Hazy golden shade with a white cap. Hint of calvados barrel in the aroma. Tastes old, musty, dry and sour. Getting some apple here too, but it felt more like a regular lambic note than a barrel influence. Nice enough without really pushing the limits.

Draught at Mikkeller & Friends. Hazy orange liquid with a small white head. Aroma of apple, funk, calvados, lemon and grain. Taste is dry and light to medium sour with notes of apples and wood. Light to medium bodied with light carbonation. Nice.

Off yellow to gold slightly hazy. Small head fades slowly. Nose is bitter and wheat forward. Taste is a chewy granola bar with tree fruit, oak and absolutely no sour at all. Actually a mild tart finish. Medium body great carbonation. Nice but not at all a lambic.

Draught @ Mikkeller & Friends. Aroma has grapefruit, earthy tones and some apricot. No signs of calvados here. Flavour is rather leathery with gastric acid, grapefruit and some orange. Refreshing and nice, although the gastric notes do try to get me.

Tap @ Mikkeller & Friends.
Pours clear paddle golden color with a small head. White wine like aroma with wooden notes and white grapes. Similar flavor with wooden notes and earthy notes.
2345

Draught @ Mikkeller & Friends, Copenhagen

Pours yellowish orange with a tiny head. Aroma of tartish berries, sourness, hints of wood and citrus. Taste is smooth, sweetish and mild tartness and sourish notes. Finish is smooth and mildly tart with some woodiness. Okay.

Draught @ Mikkeller & Friends, Copenhagen. Pours a hazy orange colour with a small head. Aroma of green apples, citrus and some berries. Flavour of tart apricot, green apples, floral notes and fresh chewy grapefruit. Medium bodied and a tart, dry, citrusy finish. Refreshing and nice.

On tap @ Mikkeller Bar. This is a deep orange /golden looking one, cloudy in the glass with a bit islandy and sidesticking white top. It smells a bit like sløydsal/woodshop. Lots of fresh chopped wood, burned wood, sour apricots and power tools. There is also a brett touch here, light lemonish with cacti and more fresh wood. Sider perhaps? I really kinda like it. In the mouth this is soft oily and its a bit soft on the prickling bubbles. I really enjoy the flavors. So refreshing. I just had about 8 different types of sours, but this has to be the best one - by far! Semi dry I suppose you might call this cause it has some mild balancing sweetness left, some soft peachy traces, sour green apple zest and its just really packed with flavor. Would not mind revisiting this again and again. 10.01.2014
On tap at The Trappist. Pours golden with a modest off-white head and a strange cheesy aroma. There is a fairly sour fruit flavor with a dry finish.

Growler From mikkeller bar. tasted august 2013. it got a bit too much of fire in the aroma and taste, alcohol is a bit too much present. Al tough the calvados is beautiful in its own but here it feels a bit like the poured a shot of calvados in to the beer instead of aging it with the beer. that said its one of the best beers ive had from boon, always fun with experimental beers.
Draught at Mikkeller Bar. Hazy golden with a white head. Aroma sour, notes of oak, vanilla, apple (calvados?). Flavor medium sour and bitter, ending dry. Light body.

Tap @ Mikkeller and friends ... It pours dark orange with no head .. The aroma is fruity, light malty and sour ... The flavor is fresh, easy drinkable, fruity, citrus, sweet malty and a nice balanced sourness..

Tap @ Mikkeller Bar. Cloudy golden color. Soapy off white head. Aromas: sour, oak, vanilla. Retronasal: sour, white wine/champagne (probably due to the calvados), lots of tannines, oak, vanilla. Flavor is moderate sour and moderate bitter. Light bodied. Very dry finish with a moderate bitterness. Lambic with an interesting twist.

Tap at Mikkeller Bar. Dry, funky nose, dust, hay, lemon, some apple / Calvados. Woody, lemony, dry flavor with dust, leather. Light to medium sourness. Very drinkable. Dry finish with fruit. Complex and tasty.

Draught @ Mikkeller & Friends. Pours hazy pale golden with a frothy white head that slowly dissipates while leaving a small trace on the glass. Smell is sour, tart and fruity with lemon juice, green apples, hay, dry soil, lemon zest, wood, barnyard and hints of horseblanket. Taste is sour and tart with crackers, lemon juice, grapefruit juice, green apples, hay, dry soil, leather, barnyard, horseblanket, wood and hints of brandy. Mouthfeel is dry, tiny round and light to medium bodied. Finish is dry and tart with crackers, lemon juice, dry soil, hay, leather, barnyard, green apples and brandy. Very interesting and quite tasty.

Keg at Mikkeller & Friends during CBC Weekend. Pours hazy gold with a fine, white foam head. Lots of jammy fruits and vinegar. Super tart and vinegary. Light bodied with fine carbonation. Tart finish, more balsamic vinegar, tangy berries. Decent.
3rd May 2013CBC. Mikkeller & Friends.Tired rating! Cloudy amber beer, little white head. Light crisp palate.Light fruity sourness. A little bitter. Light dry finish.

Draught at Mikkeller and Friends, Copenhagen. Hazy yellow coloured beer with no carbonation and a smaller white head. Rather fruity and light sour hinted aroma with some dry oaky grainy touches. Medium to full palate. FInish is light sour dry fruity with a short grainy note. Fruity type lambic, with long tarter ending. Not bad.

Keg @ Mikkeller & Friends. The pours medium amber with a small head. The nose is tart acetic funk. Notes of vinegar, pennies, balsamic. The taste is very sharp and acetic. Tangy citrus fruits, hints of vinegar, oak wood. Light body, very soft on the palate. Overall, pretty nice, if one-dimensional.

Draught. Creamy white good mostly lasting head. Dark yellow colour. Light maltyn and hoppy nice sour aroma. Calvados barrel just present. Light bitter nice sour flavor. Average finish. Oily palate. Nice.

On tap at Mikkeller & Friends, pours a cloudy orange with a small off-white head. Aroma of tart light fruits, wheat, and low barnyard funky notes. Flavour of sour fruits, oak barrels, and barnyard funk. Very tart and funky, with a touch of acidity and with a wheaty tart finish. Complex and so easily drinkable. Great stuff.

[5/2/13] Draught at Mikkeler & Friends in Copenhagen. Hazy orange. Great aroma of barnyard, oak, apples, citrus and a hint of alcohol. Sour and funky flavor with a bit of vinegar notes, apples notes and lemon. Medium-bodied. Nice.
On tap. Cloudy bright orange with little head. Fresh aroma of citrus and citric acid. Taste is very citric with grapefruit and wood notes notes

Draught at Mikkeller& Friends, Copenhagen. Spmewhat hazy golsrn beer wirh a small offwhite head. Sourish rubber aroma, citrus, leather, floral, grapefruit, sourish, grapefruit notes. Floral sourish flavor, leather, sour, perfume, grapes, some leather.

Dract at Mikkeller & Friends. Cloudy golden with a small white head. Tart tannic acid nose with strong notes of apples and wood. Medium body, tart fruity falvor, woody, bonedry and sulphurous with bretty  notes. Tart, tannic and dry finish.

Draft at Mikkeller&Friends. Pours a hazy orange with no head. Smells sweet and funky. Tastes strange.. whisky with a keen sweetness, followed by a slightly stringent bitter-sour. Finishes bitterish. Its a strange one.

Tap @ Fairbar. Pours hazy golden with a dense creamy offwhite head. Arma of hay, dusty, barnyard, wood, green apples, white wine. Taste is tart and dry with dusty hay notes, barn, green apples, wood, grapes. Thinbody, low carbonation, dry finish. 140412
Tap @ Fairbar, Aarhus. Hazy golden with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, grapes and moderate barnyard. Flavor is quite sweet and moderate acidic. Dry and moderate acidic finish. 140412
Tap @ Fairbar. Nice head with good duration. Color is hazy golden. Aroma and taste are sour brett, fruits, malt and hops. Nice sour finish.
Tap. Hazy golden with no head. Aroma is malt, fruit, tart, brett and barnyard. Flavour is malt, fruit, tart, sour, barnyard, brett, dry, little oak and a little citrus.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Bar, Copenhagen (Aug 8th, 2011). Ive written this down as Boon Calvados Lambic. Slightly hazy golden colour with a minor slightly off-white head. Aroma is sweetish sour wooden notes with some mild spices and mild honey as well. Flavour is sweetish sour wood along with mild vanilla and some quite sugary sweet notes. A bit messy, but interesting attempt.

Pours light and cloudy orange colour with almost no head. Fresh aroma of citrics fruits like pomelo. Medium sweetness, and very, very citric taste. Hints of grapefruit. Medium body, oily feel, soft carbonation and some late sour citric on the after taste. Very weird but worth the try.
From tap at the bar, you can discerned the calvados taste. Quite dry taste with some fruit flavour and distinct aftertaste.

On tap at Mikkeller Bar in June 2011.

Hazy dark orange with no head. Nice funky aroma with notes of calvados. The taste was very refreshing and dry with funk, wood and grapefruit. I liked this one a lot.

Smells fresh and fruity with a hint of pears and apples along with the sourness and earthyness you normally find in a lambic. Somewhere in the nose fragments of the calvados cask can be noticed. The taste is fresh and well balanced, not to sour. The body is surprisingly light. This is a beer I could drink all night.
Cask at Brasserie 4:20. Orange body, white head. Aroma of sour apples, some wood and tart. Flavour has fruits, mostly apple. Some acid. Light bodied. Sourness is very dry. Woody afterfeeling.
Nose is soursweet, wood, some alcohol, later bitter hops, lemon notes, feel is quite broad, carb is medium, taste is dry lemon, wood, fresh, bitter hops, some later sour citrus
Unclear golden of color with a small white head. An aroma of citrus, dentist, wood, fennel and fresh. A flavor of wood, calvados, spice and dry.

Draft @Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen. Pours a hazy pale orange color with no head. Has a fruity funky sour calvados aroma. Fruity sour tart bitter apple and wood flavor. Has a sour tart funky woody calvados finish.

Pale gold lambik, slim crispy foam on head. Aroma is moderate yeasty.
Sourness is balanced with a note of light sweetness. Not as balanced as foeder, but nice. Moderate acid, medium citric - grapefruits - and tart. Sharp biting citric sourness in the end. Watery texture. Completely flat.

Hand tapped on plastic bottle 2 weeks prior to tasting. Pours a hazy yellow with a diminishing off-white head. Aroma is sour and spicy; mostly fennel. Sugary. Dont really know what to make of it; not really bad, but not very good either. Flavour is tart and sweetish. Dry ,sour finish. Meh. 25.09.10.

A Mes rate. Cask (CASK!!!) at 4:20Very clean, solid gold body with a very impressive foamy white head. Absolutely excellent. The Calvados is just a hint and adds plenty of body and interest. Superbly tangy, the recent lambic Ive had from Boon has been seriously good. Effortlessly drinkable, not a hint of the higher abv and a glorious, almost Girardin like lemony kick in the finish. Superb.

Draught at Mikkeller Bar. High fluffy white head. Mazy yellow body. Acidic fruity dry and dusty mild and sweet aroma. Highly carbonated acidic lemon apple grapefruit flavor with a long bitter aftertaste.
Golden with a small white head. Complex fruity aroma dominated by pear and apple, with wood and resin notes. Dry and tart flavourwith strong apple notes and some wood
Tap @ Mikkeller Bar. Pours unclear orange with a off white head. Sweet calvdados, leather and manuer. Mouldy and sour flavor. I didnt feel like the calvados fit in here.

At Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen, DK.
Tap, 031010.
Yellow with white head. Aroma of sourness. Flavor with notes of grape, apples and usual celler profile

Unclear medium grey yellow color with a small, fizzy, fair lacing, mostly diminishing, off-white to white head. Aroma is moderate yeasty, white wine, grape - calvodos, plum - apple, light leather - barnyard, light tart. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and light acidic with a average to long duration, dry, light wood. Body is medium, texture is watery to oily, carbonation is flat. [20100911]
Pours cloudy golden with a white head. Aroma is malt, acidic, leather and barnyard. Flavour is malt, light acidic, apple, leather and a sweet note.

Got this on tap and while I generally love the genre I almost thought something was wrong here. The aroma was neutral but the taste was overly bitter and metallic. Words like "unpleasant", "mistake", and "aluminium" were uttered around the table.

Handbottled. Pale yellow pour, some quickly disappearing head. Aroma has semi-artificial apple, berry, cherry, fennel thing going, citrus, toilet cleaner, just like Fanta Pink Grape. Really interesting. Taste is overload on the calvados, apples, tart oakiness, booze, turpentine.

Handbottled by Theis. Hazy amber body witha small white head. The aroma is fruit, calvados, light acid and wet wood. The flavour is apples, calvados, light acid and some medicine. Very dry finish. Nice.
Håndtappet at T&Ms. Pours a slightly hazy light amber with no head. Quite dr with a mellow sourness and aromas of dried grapes. Tiny hints of a carbonation. Medium bodied. Dried finish.

Draught during sour weekend at Mikkellerbar, b-day present from evil stepdad. This was a nice clean lambic. Hazy yellow with a small white head. nice molden and grapefruit aroma, tart flavor, low bitterness and just the right amount of alchohol. Great
Draught. Hazy golden colou, short white head. Calvados sweetish tart fruity woodish aroma. Good mouthfeel. Tart woody calvados fruity flavour. Pleasant.

Tap @ Mikkeller Bar, Cph.
Pours muddy pale darkish yellow with a small, creamy, white rim. Aroma is softly tart, oaky, light wheat sweetness, some green apple. Highish carbonation, kinda light and slightly watery palate - mostly because of the oaky dryness. Flavour is mildly tart, extremely dry, some vanilla, light malty sweetness in there. Long, lingering, light vinious and very dry finish. Too bad that it feels so thin and the oak takes up so much of the flavours.

Draught at Mikkeller Bar.
Hazy golden coloured with a small white head.
Light acidic aroma of barnyard with notes of oak and calvados.
Light acidic flavour of oak, barnyard and calvados.
Tart finish.

cloudy yellow, small white head.
mild aroma, very subdued, 
flavor is dry, fruity flavor like champaigne or white wine , ends pretty much like it tastes. alc well hidden. refreshing.

Handbottle 50 cl. Courtesy of KimJohansen. Cloudy and opaque golden with a small white head. Tart Brett and barnyard in the nose. Medium body, tart fruitiness, dry and sulphurous with Bretty notes. Tart and dry finish - like a dry white wine. 120910

On tap at Mikkeller. 
Pours hazy golden with no head. 
Aroma is grape, apples, wood and a hint for earth, but a little subdued. 
The flavour is very bitter, with notes of alcohol, apples and calvados, almost pungent, and a little bit of dry grape in the finish.

From tap at MikkellerBar. Pours hazy yellow with an almost fully gone head. Aroma is dry barnyard. Flat malty and only slight sourish - not fullblown - rather mellow/subtle. Dry herbal. Dry and slight herbal bitter into the finish.

Fad: Orange øl uden nogen form for karbonering. Jeg ved godt det ikke er meningen, men jeg savner det nu alligevel. Duften er fin sur, stald og meget diskret æble. Den er lidt mere tydelig i smagen, men man skal lede en del efter calvados fadene. Men der mangler karbonering for min smag.

Draught. Golden coloured. Hazy. Off White fluffy head. Sweetness, lighT fruits. Light sourness, vague calva. Flavour is vague sour, has some sweetness, some citrus. Medium bodied. Citric sourness in the end
Draught at MikkellerBAR. Cloudy golden - white edges. Sourish aroma. Soft body. Apple/calvados taste. High wooden. Light cactus. Lacto. Nice.

Draft. A very hazy orangey beer with no head. The aroma has notes of horseblanket, brettanomyces, grapefruit, and grapes. The flavor is lightly sour with notes of grapefruit, brettanomyces, grapes, and a bit of horseblanket, leading to a tart finish.
